intro: Jacquemontia nelsonii, commonly known as Nelson's golden vine, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Convolvulaceae family, which includes many vines and flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its trailing growth habit and showy yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are heart-shaped and often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or swampy areas.
